servinfo.title: Higher than standard level in both “D” and “R” range
servinfo.ptxt: This test is to check overall performance of automatic transmission and engine by measuring stall speed at “D” and “R” ranges. Be sure to perform this test only when transmission fluid is at normal operating temperature and its level is between FULL and LOW marks.

item.ptxt: Do not run engine at stall more than 5 seconds continuously, for fluid temperature may rise excessively high.
After performing stall test, be sure to leave engine running at idle for longer than 1 minute before another stall test.
Do not perform stall test at transfer position in 4L.

s1.ptxt: Apply parking brake and block wheels.
Start engine with select lever shifted to “P”.
Shift select lever to “D” and depress accelerator pedal fully while watching tachometer. Read engine rpm quickly when it has become constant (stall speed).
Release accelerator pedal immediately after stall speed is checked.
In the same way, check stall speed in “R” range.
Stall speed should be within following specification.

condition.ptxt: Higher than standard level in both “D” and “R” range

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of pressure control solenoid valve (Low line pressure)

action.ptxt: Inspect. If NG, replace valve body assembly.

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of primary regulator valve (Low line pressure)
Leakage from both “D” and “R” range fluid pressure circuit

action.ptxt: Overhaul or replace valve body assembly.
